headline: Stock Pickers See Their Moment to Shine in Market’s AI Freak-Out
summary: Yes, artificial intelligence is likely to disrupt companies and put some of them out of business.  When a new AI tool threatens to upset an industry, investors are simply selling the whole group.  “We’re having a shakeout, but it’s a good buying opportunity,” said Gina Bolvin Bernarduci, president at Bolvin Wealth Management Group, who says she’s snapping up tech shares after valuations for the group have retreated.

content.title: Stock Pickers See Their Moment to Shine in Market’s AI Freak-Out
content.summary: Yes, artificial intelligence is likely to disrupt companies and put some of them out of business.  When a new AI tool threatens to upset an industry, investors are simply selling the whole group.  “We’re having a shakeout, but it’s a good buying opportunity,” said Gina Bolvin Bernarduci, president at Bolvin Wealth Management Group, who says she’s snapping up tech shares after valuations for the group have retreated.

headline: Warner Bros rejects Paramount's revised offer, but gives studio a week to negotiate better deal
summary: Warner Bros Discovery has rejected Paramount Skydance's latest $30-a-share hostile takeover bid, but is giving the Hollywood studio seven days to see if it can come up with a better deal to buy the owner of HBO Max and the "Harry Potter" franchise, Warner Bros said in a statement.  Paramount informally broached an ‌even higher share price, $31 a share, Warner Bros said, apparently enticing the board to the table.  The rival bidder now has until February 23 to submit its "best and final offer," which Netflix ‌is allowed to match under the terms of the merger agreement, Warner Bros said on Tuesday.

content.title: Warner Bros rejects Paramount's revised offer, but gives studio a week to negotiate better deal
content.summary: Warner Bros Discovery has rejected Paramount Skydance's latest $30-a-share hostile takeover bid, but is giving the Hollywood studio seven days to see if it can come up with a better deal to buy the owner of HBO Max and the "Harry Potter" franchise, Warner Bros said in a statement.  Paramount informally broached an ‌even higher share price, $31 a share, Warner Bros said, apparently enticing the board to the table.  The rival bidder now has until February 23 to submit its "best and final offer," which Netflix ‌is allowed to match under the terms of the merger agreement, Warner Bros said on Tuesday.

headline: Micron Is Spending Big to Break the AI Memory Bottleneck
summary: $200 billion That's the amount Micron Technology is spending to expand its U.S. manufacturing. The memory-chip maker is racing to avert the biggest supply crunch the industry has seen in more than 40 years.

content.title: Micron Is Spending Big to Break the AI Memory Bottleneck
content.summary: $200 billion That's the amount Micron Technology is spending to expand its U.S. manufacturing. The memory-chip maker is racing to avert the biggest supply crunch the industry has seen in more than 40 years.

headline: This Energy Provider Wins Data-Center Deal With Oracle. The Stock Is Rising.
summary: Shares of  DTE Energy  jumped Tuesday after the Michigan-based energy company won an agreement to power  Oracle’s  data center in Saline Township, Mich.  DTE, which provides electricity and natural gas to millions of customers across Michigan, will provide 1.4 gigawatts of power for  Oracle’s  facility after getting approval from the Michigan Public Service Commission.  The deal is DTE’s first with a hyperscale data center, the company said.

content.title: This Energy Provider Wins Data-Center Deal With Oracle. The Stock Is Rising.

The deal is DTE’s first with a hyperscale data center, the company said.

headline: This Energy Provider Has a Data-Center Deal With Oracle. The Stock Is Rising After Earnings.
summary: Shares of  DTE Energy  jumped Tuesday after the Michigan-based energy company reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings as it prepares to power  Oracle’s  data center in Saline Township, Mich.  The company reiterated its 2026 forecast for operating earnings per share of $7.59 to $7.73.  DTE stock was up 2.2% in premarket trading, having spiked 30% earlier in the session.

headline: Oracle Lawsuits Test AI Growth Story And Recent Share Price Slide
summary: Several securities fraud class action lawsuits have been filed against Oracle, alleging it misled investors about the financial impact and risks of its AI infrastructure investments. The suits also claim Oracle misrepresented the scale and implications of new government cloud contracts, including work with the US Air Force and the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services. These legal actions come as Oracle continues to win large public sector cloud and AI deals that are central to its growth...

content.title: Oracle Lawsuits Test AI Growth Story And Recent Share Price Slide
content.summary: Several securities fraud class action lawsuits have been filed against Oracle, alleging it misled investors about the financial impact and risks of its AI infrastructure investments. The suits also claim Oracle misrepresented the scale and implications of new government cloud contracts, including work with the US Air Force and the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services. These legal actions come as Oracle continues to win large public sector cloud and AI deals that are central to its growth...
